original:
Gregory the Illuminator is a significant figure in the history of Armenian architecture, particularly in the context of the country's early Christian period. Many churches built during this time were constructed on the sites of previously destroyed pagan temples and incorporated elements of pre-Christian Armenian architectural styles.

Armenian architecture can be divided into four distinct periods:
